docs.snippet: As Mr. Duterte appears poised to become the country’s next president, people who know him well say the depiction of him as a crass vigilante is an oversimplification....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Mr. Duterte appears poised to become the country’s next president, people who know him well say the depiction of him as a crass vigilante is an oversimplification.
docs.abstract: Rodrigo Duterte, mayor of Davao City, Philippines, and unconventional candidate for president, appears poised to win election, with ongoing tally showing that he has so far earned 39 percent of vote; Duterte's sometimes crass comments and dark history of overseeing 1,000 extrajudicial killings during his time as mayor stand at odds with good deeds and soft side reported by his constituents.

headline.main: Rodrigo Duterte’s Many Sides: Brash and Crude or Tough and Shrewd
headline.print_headline: Vigilante Leader With a Soft Side

byline.contributor: Floyd Whaley reported from Davao City, and Richard C. Paddock from Manila.
byline.original: By FLOYD WHALEY and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

docs.snippet: The movement called Beirut, My City performed surprisingly well in municipal elections, emerging as an unlikely alternative to feudal political bosses....
docs.lead_paragraph: The movement called Beirut, My City performed surprisingly well in municipal elections, emerging as an unlikely alternative to feudal political bosses.
docs.abstract: Beirut, My City, political party formed by Lebanese citizens, wins about 40 percent of vote in municipal elections, sending powerful message to political bosses who have sought to maintain control of country's politics; while rigid election laws prevent independent political parties from challenging sectarian factions at national level, municipal elections provide opening for those weary of ineffectual and corrupt government.

headline.main: Beirut Upstarts Gain Traction in Lebanon’s Political Quagmire
headline.print_headline: Beirut Upstarts Find Footing in Political Quagmire

headline.main: Poland's PM Slams Previous Gov't as Harmful, Wasteful
headline.print_headline: Poland's PM Slams Previous Gov't as Harmful, Wasteful

docs.snippet: The French president forced through a measure that he says will encourage employers to hire more. Opponents say it weakens worker protections....
docs.lead_paragraph: The French president forced through a measure that he says will encourage employers to hire more. Opponents say it weakens worker protections.
docs.abstract: France's Socialist government forces through overhaul of country's labor laws, saying it will encourage hiring and reduce unemployment; ignores criticisms and protests that have dogged process.

headline.main: Hollande Bypasses France’s Lower House on Labor Law Overhaul
headline.print_headline: French President Bypasses Lower House on Labor Law Changes

docs.snippet: Josh Kriegman and Elyse Steinberg’s documentary “Weiner” records Anthony D. Weiner’s scandal-plagued New York mayoral bid in 2013....
docs.lead_paragraph: Josh Kriegman and Elyse Steinberg’s documentary “Weiner” records Anthony D. Weiner’s scandal-plagued New York mayoral bid in 2013.
docs.abstract: Feature-length documentary Weiner, directed by Josh Kriegman and Elyse Steinberg, chronicles former Rep Anthony D Weiner's New York City mayoral campaign in 2013 and its ultimate failure.

headline.main: ‘Weiner’ Covers a Political Campaign Set on Self-Destruct
headline.print_headline: Covering a Campaign Set on Self-Destruct
